sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Contact Angle Goniometer for measuring the contact angle and surface wettability properties of pharmaceutical materials and coatings.
sections.scope: Applicable to contact angle and surface energy measurement activities carried out in the Central Instrumentation.
procedure: Ensure the instrument is placed on an anti-vibration table in a dust-free environment.
Power ON the instrument including the light source, camera, and computer system.
Launch the contact angle analysis software and initialize camera settings.
Calibrate the system using a standard calibration target if required.
Clean the sample stage thoroughly and ensure it is level and properly aligned.
Prepare the test sample ensuring the surface is clean, dry, and free from contamination.
Mount the sample securely on the stage using appropriate fixtures or adhesive.
Position the sample surface in focus under the camera with proper illumination.
Load the test liquid (water, buffer, or specific solvent) into the dispensing syringe.
Adjust the needle position above the sample surface at the desired height.
Dispense a controlled droplet of known volume onto the sample surface.
Capture the droplet image immediately after deposition for static contact angle measurement.
Use the software to identify the droplet profile and baseline for angle calculation.
Measure contact angles on both sides of the droplet and record the values.
Repeat measurements at different locations on the sample surface for reproducibility.
If performing dynamic measurements, capture images at specified time intervals.
Clean the sample stage and needle after measurements to prevent cross-contamination.
Save all images and data files with proper identification for documentation.
Power OFF the system and cover the instrument to protect from dust.
precautions: Ensure the sample surface is flat and free from defects for accurate measurements.
Avoid vibrations and air currents during droplet deposition and image capture.
Use appropriate PPE when handling chemicals and solvents for droplet preparation.
Dispose of used liquids and cleaning solvents according to safety guidelines.
Regularly calibrate the instrument to maintain measurement accuracy.
Handle the dispensing needle carefully to avoid damage or contamination.
Maintain consistent droplet volume for comparative measurements.
Allow sufficient time between measurements for the droplet to stabilize if needed.
